      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<span class="line"><!---->8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<!----></span><br><br>-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<span class="line"><!---->Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<!----></span><br>Google - Chromium<span class="line"><!---->Google - Chromium<!----></span><br><br>-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<!----></span><br>* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <span class="line"><!---->* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <!----></span>75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8"><!---->75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<!----></a><br>* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<span class="line"><!---->* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<!----></span><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br>Hello,<span class="line"><!---->Hello,<!----></span><br><br>we added the report in a document as the character limit prevented us from adding it in the previous page<span class="line"><!---->we added the report in a document as the character limit prevented us from adding it in the previous page<!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>114.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->114.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not         This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<!----></span><br><br>The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <span class="line"><!---->The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <!----></span>ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64"><!---->ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<!----></a>, x64 asan build:<span class="line"><!---->, x64 asan build:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<span class="line"><!---->index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>* info) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo&lt;v8::Value&gt;* info) {<!----></span><br>   }<span class="line"><!---->   }<!----></span><br><br>   OnExit(isolate, false);<span class="line"><!---->   OnExit(isolate, false);<!----></span><br>+  for (int i = 0; i < 30000; i++) sleep(0);<span class="line"><!---->+  for (int i = 0; i &lt; 30000; i++) sleep(0);<!----></span><br>   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<span class="line"><!---->   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<!----></span><br> }<span class="line"><!----> }<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <span class="line"><!---->This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <!----></span><br><br>I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <span class="line"><!---->I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <!----></span><br><br>CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<span class="line"><!---->CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        mr-issue-page {

        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1465641%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D0" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1465641%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D0%252526ust%25253D1703397329740274%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw3mcEXRIZ9zsS7CLV70mAxK%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);

        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1465641: ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerab
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      zdi-d...@trendmicro.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/968568344" title="zdi-d...@trendmicro.com"><!---->zdi-d...@trendmicro.com<!----></a>
      zdi-d...@trendmicro.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->zdi-d...@trendmicro.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

            on

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<span class="line"><!---->8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<!----></span><br><br>-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<span class="line"><!---->Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<!----></span><br>Google - Chromium<span class="line"><!---->Google - Chromium<!----></span><br><br>-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<!----></span><br>* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <span class="line"><!---->* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <!----></span>75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8"><!---->75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<!----></a><br>* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<span class="line"><!---->* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<!----></span><br><br>---<span         I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <span class="line"><!---->I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <!----></span><br><br>To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <span class="line"><!---->To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <!----></span><br><br>> const worker = new Worker(func, {"type": "function"});<span class="line"><!---->&gt; const worker = new Worker(func, {"type": "function"});<!----></span><br><br>However, when run within Chrome's JavaScript console, the same line results in the following error: <span class="line"><!---->However, when run within Chrome's JavaScript console, the same line results in the following error: <!----></span><br><br>> Uncaught TypeError: Failed to construct 'Worker': Failed to read the 'type' property from 'WorkerOptions': The provided value 'function' is not a valid enum value of type WorkerType. at <anonymous>:1:16<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Uncaught TypeError: Failed to construct 'Worker': Failed to read the 'type' property from 'WorkerOptions': The provided value 'function' is not a valid enum value of type WorkerType. at &lt;anonymous&gt;:1:16<!----></span><br><br>Given these errors it's currently difficult to see how the provided POC could achieve intended execution and subsequently result in the ASan crash described above. <span class="line"><!---->Given these errors it's currently difficult to see how the provided POC could achieve intended execution and subsequently result in the ASan crash described above. <!----></span><br><br>I'm without access to a Windows machine today, so I can't try the pagehead suggestion, but we'll keep tinkering. Any further guidance to assist with repro is appreciated. <span class="line"><!---->I'm without access to a Windows machine today, so I can't try the pagehead suggestion, but we'll keep tinkering. Any further guidance to assist with repro is appreciated. <!----></span><br><br>CCing the current on-duty V8 security sheriff for visibility while we continue trying to reproduce the crash.<span class="line"><!---->CCing the current on-duty V8 security sheriff for visibility while we continue trying to reproduce the crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <br>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<!----></span><br><br>The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <span class="line"><!---->The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <!----></span>ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64"><!---->ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<!----></a>, x64 asan build:<span class="line"><!---->, x64 asan build:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<span class="line"><!---->index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>* info) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo&lt;v8::Value&gt;* info) {<!----></span><br>   }<span class="line"><!---->   }<!----></span><br><br>   OnExit(isolate, false);<span class="line"><!---->   OnExit(isolate, false);<!----></span><br>+  for (int i = 0; i < 30000; i++) sleep(0);<span class="line"><!---->+  for (int i = 0; i &lt; 30000; i++) sleep(0);<!----></span><br>   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<span class="line"><!---->   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<!----></span><br> }<span class="line"><!----> }<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <span class="line"><!---->This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <!----></span><br><br>I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <span class="line"><!---->I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <!----></span><br><br>CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<span class="line"><!---->CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;

        }

          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            min-height: 0;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<span class="line"><!---->8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<!----></span><br><br>-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<span class="line"><!---->Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<!----></span><br>Google - Chromium<span class="line"><!---->Google - Chromium<!----></span><br><br>-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<!----></span><br>* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <span class="line"><!---->* Version 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<span class="line"><!---->* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<!----></span><br><br>---<span         Thanks for the report. The attached .zip appears to be encrypted and I am unable to open it. In lieu of attaching a .zip, please upload each file directly as an attachment.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. The attached .zip appears to be encrypted and I am unable to open it. In lieu of attaching a .zip, please upload each file directly as an attachment.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

0x7ffd76866ac8<!----></span><br>READ of size 1 at 0x50d000006998 thread T0<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 1 at 0x50d000006998 thread T0<!----></span><br>lab@vm:~/Desktop$ <span class="line"><!---->lab@vm:~/Desktop$ <!----></span><br><br><br>The easiest way to trigger it is by using a windows version (make sure to enable pageheap[1] before running PoC).<span         I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <span class="line"><!---->I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <!----></span><br><br>To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <span class="line"><!---->To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <!----></span><br><br>> const worker = new Worker(func, {"type": "function"});<span class="line"><!---->&gt;           Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ahaas@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          cbruni@chromium.org ishell@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -Blink&gt;JavaScript Blink&gt;JavaScript&gt;Runtime
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<!----></span><br><br>The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <span class="line"><!---->The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <!----></span>ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64"><!---->ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<!----></a>, x64 asan build:<span class="line"><!---->, x64 asan build:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<span class="line"><!---->index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>* info) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo&lt;v8::Value&gt;* info) {<!----></span><br>   }<span class="line"><!---->   }<!----></span><br><br>   OnExit(isolate, false);<span class="line"><!---->   OnExit(isolate, false);<!----></span><br>+  for (int i = 0; i < 30000; i++) sleep(0);<span class="line"><!---->+  for (int i = 0; i &lt; 30000; i++) sleep(0);<!----></span><br>   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<span class="line"><!---->   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<!----></span><br> }<span class="line"><!----> }<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This looks like a duplicate of <span class="line"><!---->This looks like a duplicate of <!----></span>https://crbug.com/v8/13399<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/v8/issues/detail?id=13399" title="mjsunit/regress/regress-v8-12219 starts failing (flag fuzzer)"><!---->https://crbug.com/v8/13399<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>And I am not sure if this a security issue from Chrome's POV, as it's an issue in d8 only.<span class="line"><!---->And I am not sure if this a security issue from Chrome's POV, as it's an issue in d8 only.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1465641#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1465641#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 19, 2023, 11:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          saelo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          saelo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <span class="line"><!---->This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <!----></span><br><br>I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <span class="line"><!---->I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <!----></span><br><br>CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<span class="line"><!---->CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        Since there were no objections after a few days, I'm circling back to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal bug due to absence of impact in an eligible supported shipping product. <span class="line"><!---->Since there were no objections after a few days, I'm circling back to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal bug due to absence of impact in an eligible supported shipping product. <!----></span><br><br>This change involves dropping security triage flags, lowering priority, and removing visibility restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This change involves dropping security triage flags, lowering priority, and removing visibility restrictions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);

          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;

          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    Send email<chops-checkbox checked="true">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<span class="line"><!---->8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<!----></span><br><br>-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<span class="line"><!---->Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<!----></span><br>Google - Chromium<span class="line"><!---->Google - Chromium<!----></span><br><br>-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<!----></span><br>* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <span class="line"><!---->* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <!----></span>75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8"><!---->75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<!----></a><br>* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<span class="line"><!---->* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<!----></span><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br>Hello,<span class="line"><!---->Hello,<!----></span><br><br>we added the report in a document as the character limit prevented us from adding it         I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <span class="line"><!---->I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <!----></span><br><br>To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <span class="line"><!---->To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <!----></span><br><br>> const worker = new Worker(func, {"type": "function"});<span class="line"><!---->&gt;         This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->This particular issue is related to d8 and implementation of Shell::QuitOnce - main thread is executing JS code while the Isolate was already destroyed by the call to `this.testRunner.quit();` from the worker thread. I'm not sure if a similar issue could happen in Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to ahaas@ who worked on task manager implementation vs Isolate shut down.<!----></span><br><br>The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <span class="line"><!---->The following change helps to reproduce the issue on <!----></span>ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64"><!---->ed93bef7ab786d5367c2ae7882922c23aa0eda64<!----></a>, x64 asan build:<span class="line"><!---->, x64 asan build:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/src/d8/d8.cc b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<span class="line"><!---->index c4b8f7ecda6..ecd60169779 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/src/d8/d8.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>* info) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -2991,6 +2991,7 @@ void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo&lt;v8::Value&gt;* info) {<!----></span><br>   }<span class="line"><!---->   }<!----></span><br><br>   OnExit(isolate, false);<span class="line"><!---->   OnExit(isolate, false);<!----></span><br>+  for (int i = 0; i < 30000; i++) sleep(0);<span class="line"><!---->+  for (int i = 0; i &lt; 30000; i++) sleep(0);<!----></span><br>   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<span class="line"><!---->   base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);<!----></span><br> }<span class="line"><!----> }<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <span class="line"><!---->This particular POC doesn't seem exploitable in Chrome because it appears to require d8's specific use of v8::shell to set up the UaF. <!----></span><br><br>I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <span class="line"><!---->I'm less certain whether Chrome ever holds onto an task after the associated Worker is freed, which may be worth exploring for variants present in Chrome, and I believe abusing object life cycle issues during Worker destruction is already a known bug pattern. However, if found, those would be different bugs than the one described here, so for the purposes of Chrome Security triage I'm inclined to convert this report from a Security Bug into a normal Bug. <!----></span><br><br>CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<span class="line"><!---->CCing V8 Security explicitly so they get an opportunity to correct me if I've incorrectly jumped to any conclusions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->ZDI-CAN-21781: Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- CVSS -----------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<span class="line"><!---->8.8: AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H<!----></span><br><br>-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- ABSTRACT -------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<span class="line"><!---->Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative has identified a vulnerability affecting the following products:<!----></span><br>Google - Chromium<span class="line"><!---->Google - Chromium<!----></span><br><br>-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-- VULNERABILITY DETAILS ------------------------<!----></span><br>* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <span class="line"><!---->* Version tested:linux-release_d8-asan-no-inline-linux-release-v8-component-88967 + V8 compiled from commit <!----></span>75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8"><!---->75a86fcbf108472efa847d067162c0d3262a4eb8<!----></a><br>* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<span class="line"><!---->* Platform tested: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208) + Ubuntu 22.04.1 64-bit<!----></span><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->Google Chromium V8 postMessage Handling Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br>Hello,<span class="line"><!---->Hello,<!----></span><br><br>we added the report in a document as the character limit prevented us from adding it in the previous page<span class="line"><!---->we added the report in a document as the character limit prevented us from adding it in the previous page<!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>114.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->114.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not         I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <span class="line"><!---->I'm partially triaging on the assumption that the report is valid, but so far neither ClusterFuzz nor I am having success with repro using the updated POC, even when repeatedly retrying the suggested 89006 d8 ASan build on a nearly identical x64 Linux test environment. <!----></span><br><br>To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <span class="line"><!---->To troubleshoot, I'm manually feeding in the POC at the d8 shell, where the following line causes d8 to abort without a discernible error. <!----></span><br><br>> const worker = new Worker(func, {"type": "function"});<span class="line"><!---->&gt; const worker = new Worker(func, {"type": "function"});<!----></span><br><br>However, when run within Chrome's JavaScript console, the same line results in the following error: <span class="line"><!---->However, when run within Chrome's JavaScript console, the same line results in the following error: <!----></span><br><br>> Uncaught TypeError: Failed to construct 'Worker': Failed to read the 'type' property from 'WorkerOptions': The provided value 'function' is not a valid enum value of type WorkerType. at <anonymous>:1:16<span class="line"><!---->&gt;
